intro: Impatiens spathulata, commonly known as the broadleaf impatiens, is a species of flowering plant in the family Balsaminaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 inches. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for shady garden areas. Its vibrant flowers, which come in shades of red, pink, and white, bloom throughout the growing season.
